title: Bates' Guide to Physical Examination and History-Taking (11th Ed
description:
Bates' Guide to Physical Examination and History-Taking (11th Ed)
by Lynn Bickley MD
Lippincott Williams & Wilkins | November 2012 | ISBN-10: 1609137620 | PDF | 1024 pages | 86.8 mb

The 11th edition of the pre-eminent textbook on physical examination contains foundational content to guide studentsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ approaches to history taking, interviewing, and other core assessment skills, as well as fully illustrated, step-by-step techniques that outline correct performance of physical examination. The book features a vibrant full-color art program and an easy-to-follow two-column format with step-by-step examination techniques on the left and abnormalities with differential diagnoses on the right. The comprehensive, evidence-based content is intended for medical students, high-level nursing education and practice markets, as well as related health professions such as physician assistants.

New for this edition:
--Content has been fully revised and updated to reflect the most recent health care literature.
--More than 200 new and revised photographs and drawings have been added to better illustrate key points in the accompanying text.
--Design and layout has been revised to increase discoverability of core material and special assessment tips.
--Techniques of interviewing chapter has been reorganized to provide clearer insights into the skills of empathic listening.

BRIEF CONTENTS
UNIT 1 Foundations of Health Assessment 1
Chapter 1 Overview: Physical Examination and History Taking 3
Chapter 2 Clinical Reasoning, Assessment, and Recording Your Findings 25
Chapter 3 Interviewing and the Health History 55
UNIT 2 Regional Examinations 103
Chapter 4 Beginning the Physical Examination: General Survey, Vital Signs, and Pain 105
Chapter 5 Behavior and Mental Status 141
Chapter 6 The Skin, Hair, and Nails 171
Chapter 7 The Head and Neck 205
Chapter 8 The Thorax and Lungs 293
Chapter 9 The Cardiovascular System 333
Chapter 10 The Breasts and Axillae 405
Chapter 11 The Abdomen 433
Chapter 12 The Peripheral Vascular System 489
Chapter 13 Male Genitalia and Hernias 519
Chapter 14 Female Genitalia 539
Chapter 15 The Anus, Rectum, and Prostate 577
Chapter 16 The Musculoskeletal System 597
Chapter 17 The Nervous System 681
UNIT 3 Special Populations 763
Chapter 18 Assessing Children: Infancy Through Adolescence 765
Chapter 19 The Pregnant Woman 893
Chapter 20 The Older Adult 917
Index 967
